title: Backbone + GroceryList
summary:
### GroceryList Business Overview

- 2024 revenue: $2.6M ARR, profitable at 25% gross margin
  - Network of 1,200 merchants across Caribbean markets
  - Diaspora-focused model: customers purchase groceries for family back home
  - Delivery within 1 hour through merchant network
  - Building integrated infrastructure: payment layer, marketplace distribution, last-mile logistics
- Growth trajectory and expansion
  - 2025 projection: 2-3x growth targeting $4-6M ARR
  - Planned expansion: Dominican Republic, Trinidad
  - Long-term vision: $500M ARR business potential
- Market positioning
  - Caribbean market fragmented, limited competition from funded companies
  - Unique geographic advantage - IDB specifically wants Caribbean investments vs Latin America focus
  - Florida launch success due to diverse immigrant communities (71k Jamaicans in Lauder Hill, large Hispanic/Caribbean populations)

### Fundraising Strategy & Pipeline Management

- Pipeline structure modeled on Mitchell’s successful top-up round (30 active conversations)
  - Target → Outreach → Active conversation → Data room → Term sheet stages
  - Fill pipeline with 30-50 relevant firms by Friday
  - Combination of Backbone relationships, GroceryList connections, and strategic targets
- Process philosophy
  - Run as sales pipeline - find supporters, don’t oversell to skeptics
  - Disqualify uninterested parties quickly to avoid time waste
  - Gate all interested investors at data room stage before release
  - Create competitive tension through well-participated process
- Target categories
  - VCs with Caribbean/Latin America focus (Harlem Capital, Streamlined Ventures, Leerer Hippeau)
- Firms with relevant portfolio (Mighty Capital - Doordash/Airbnb investments)
- Angel investors and strategic connections


- Existing momentum
  - IDB verbal commitment: $250k
  - Inbound interest from Collab Capital (principal reached out after LinkedIn revenue post)

### Investment Materials & Communication Strategy

- Investment memo refresh (due Friday)
  - Shorter, current version of existing document
  - Primary tool for outreach and meeting requests
  - Source of truth for investor conversations
  - Enable copy-paste for investor internal memos
- Monthly investor update system
  - Passive engagement tool for prospect nurturing
  - Coach investors on company language, metrics, world view
  - Strategic timing: strongest metrics highlighted month before fundraising push
  - Distribution list includes all prospects and interested parties
  - Historical success: $250k commitments directly from update emails
- Data room strategy
  - Gate qualified investors at “data room open” stage
  - Signal formal process beginning without explicit timeline pressure
  - Require demonstrated interest before resource investment

### Bicycle Capital Meeting Strategy (Tomorrow, 30 minutes)

- Participants: Stefania (Chief of Staff, likely transitioning to investment role), Annabella (Operations)
- Meeting context
  - Pre-work for Feb 16 team planning session
  - Stefania building dossier on Caribbean opportunities for firm strategy
  - Bicycle has dedicated Caribbean mandate (vs typical Latin America focus)
- Positioning and messaging
  - “Profitable business, no survival need - evaluating growth acceleration options”
  - Reference IDB verbal commitment for social proof
  - Present as having multiple paths/options, seeking best strategic fit
- Talk track structure
  - 2-3 minute company overview, then flip to questions
  - “What thesis/strategy are you working on that we match to?”
  - “What would you spend $3M on if you invested in us?”
  - Let them talk 60%+ of conversation time
- Key metrics to share
  - $2.6M revenue 2024, expecting $4-6M 2025
  - Profitable at 25% gross margin
  - 1,200 merchant network
  - Active expansion plans
- Next steps objectives
  - Request 2-3 specific portfolio company introductions
  - Add to monthly investor update distribution
  - If positive: “We’ll let you know when data room opens”
- Additional context leverage
  - Reference Backbone connection to Marcelo (Bicycle chairman, ex-Softbank)
  - Don’t elaborate unless asked - social proof positioning

### Rory CEO Development Plan

- Strategic story development
  - Create 5-minute opening narrative for investor meetings
  - Leverage background (ex-Morgan Stanley experience)
  - Design story to signal right attributes to VCs
- Role importance
  - CEO representation expected in investor meetings
  - Success depends on Rory’s ability to deliver effectively
  - Backbone will invest significant time in CEO coaching
- Relationship building approach
  - Start with personal background deep-dive session
  - Understand childhood, career journey for authentic storytelling
  - Develop comfort with VC interaction process

### Next Steps

- Elliot (by Friday)
  - Refresh investment memo to current, shorter version
  - Create initial target list: 30-50 relevant firms and angels
  - Share pipeline tracking document template
  - Send meeting notes and example monthly updates
- Jmorgan (immediate)
  - Forward all inbound investor emails to Elliot for pipeline tracking
  - Execute Bicycle meeting strategy tomorrow with positioning framework
  - Respond to future inbounds: “Traveling for customers next couple weeks, schedule end of month”
  - Avoid tagging unknown firms/people on social media posts
- Joint deliverables (by Friday)
  - Finalized investment memo ready for outreach
  - Populated pipeline with initial targets and contact strategy
  - Monthly update template and distribution plan

title: Jason + Allan Erskine + Elliot - bilateral proofs discussion
summary:
### Allan’s Background & Technology Platform

- Former Orchard backend engineer under Matt’s CEO tenure, reconnected with Elliot after crypto fund closure
  - Ran market neutral basis trading fund 2020-2022, sunk by FTX debacle
  - Returned all investor capital but expensive for partners
  - Currently in traditional finance risk/corporate bond trading with ex-Citadel colleagues
  - Previously helped JP Morgan launch triparty repo project, first team member
  - Built out Christine Moy’s Blockchain Center of Excellence team
- Building blockchain-agnostic distributed proof engine using Unison functional language
  - Unison identifies types with hash codes, robust to transitive dependencies
  - Relationships hold at runtime, instances include code with types
  - Cross-signs hashes with external data (Bitcoin blocks, etc.) for bilateral attestation
  - “You could cross sign everything… constructing the same type in two different places with the same data, and it’s effectively a proof”
- Technical architecture and performance
  - Core platform in Unison surrounded by Rust adapter fleet
  - Event stream production for downstream consumption
  - Batching/netting engine achieving 20,000 transactions/second on laptop
  - Bilateral batch construction only when clearing invariants hold (conservation of values)
  - Deployed as customer infrastructure (like Splunk/AWS) - no external access
- Cryptographic security considerations
  - Plain crypto with verified setup when both parties use platform
  - Can orchestrate MPC protocols, zero knowledge proofs, Pedersen commitments
  - “You need to design these protocols… all my types would add on top of that, you can just verify that these protocols have been followed”
  - Two-layer approach: cryptographic primitives + orchestration attestation

### XFX Business Model & Technical Challenges

- Core value proposition: “building the plumbing, the infrastructure layer to connect DeFi and TradFi”
  - Solving liquidity fragmentation between blockchain stablecoins and traditional FX
  - Primary customer pain: exposure rebalancing delays when moving to TradFi
  - “The problem of locked capital, pre funding, all of these things that make FX markets less efficient and more expensive”
- Capital velocity as key differentiator
  - “How much use can you get out of as little capital that you have tied up as possible”
  - Settlement speed bottleneck: trading platforms solved, but fund arrival/settlement remains slow
  - Current “rhythm method” approach: arbitrary waits and risk management inefficiencies
- Stablecoin market depth limitations
  - USDT/USDC remain depegged despite 1:1 promise
  - “Just a couple of bits make a big difference for us because this is a volume game”
  - Insufficient depth compared to TradFi markets
- Scaling complexity with multi-currency support
  - Simple: two counterparties, one chain
  - Complex: synthetic pairs requiring 3+ swap hops across multiple counterparties
  - “We’re taking yours and we’re swapping it three different times between these three other counterparties”
- Treasury management and internal arbitrage opportunities
  - Pre-positioning capital across currencies for optimal operations
  - Internal rebalancing when stablecoins depeg favorably
  - “Finding opportunities to arbitrage even within our own network”

### Payaway Risk Solution & Credit Extension Use Case

- Current payaway risk scenario (Brazilian real/South African rand example)
  - 11% failure rate including wrong IBANs and operational errors
  - T+1 or T+2 settlement delays on non-CLS routes
  - South African FCM discharges obligations but Brazilian side faces delay
- Allan’s bilateral proof solution for credit extension
  - Quick bilateral proof construction from “hokey software” via web endpoint
  - Validates settlement instructions correspond to original request
  - Creates distributed proof both parties can construct from same data
  - “Still a credit decision, but you can see that the risks are reduced”
- Network effects and automation potential
  - Year of attested vs non-attested transaction data enables data-driven decisions
  - Accumulated trust allows freeing up margin/trapped collateral
  - “Very short term and self liquidating” credit arrangements
- XFX integration potential
  - Release funds upon proof of settlement instructions without physical arrival
  - “When we see that Counterparty A actually signed a proof that said the settlement instructions have been confirmed, then we could release our funds”
  - Managed risk with fee-based credit extension
  - Speeds up settlement cycles for customer capital velocity

### Open Questions/Risks

- Single point of failure concern: Allan’s platform compromise affecting all network participants
- Integration complexity with existing XFX infrastructure and customer workflows
- Regulatory acceptance of proof-based settlement vs traditional correspondent banking
- Pricing model for credit extension and proof validation services
- Scalability from bilateral to multilateral proof scenarios

### Action Items & Owners

- Allan: Prepare demo showcasing proof types and batching capabilities using standardized Basel III compliance types
- Jason: Include product manager Andy in next discussion for roadmap integration assessment
- Allan: Develop visual materials demonstrating basic proofs and batch processing

### Next Steps & Scheduling

- Demo session with Allan, Jason, and Andy (XFX product manager)
  - Focus on settlement SLA improvements for XFX customers
  - Explore roadmap integration possibilities
  - Review standardized Basel III types implementation
- Elliot to sync separately with Allan and Jason post-demo
- Participants to self-schedule without Elliot involvement going forward

title: Backbone+GroceryList finalize agreement
summary:

- IDB Bank committed $500K with LOI pending lead investor
  - Met IDB team in Miami, strong alignment on underserved market focus

- Bicycle Capital meeting scheduled Thursday

- Hired fractional CFO from Walmart (27 years experience)
  - Board member of investment fund

- Target $3M round with strategic approach:
  1. Start with angel investors ($500K allocation, 5-10 angels)
  2. Move to tier 2/3 firms with angel commits as leverage

### Next Steps

- Elliot to prepare investor pipeline document for Wednesday

- Angel investor target list development

title: Backbone + Checker weekly
summary:
### Hiring Priorities

- Product Manager (cross-border payments) - highest priority
  - Specific expertise required in cross-border payments
  - Company target list provided for sourcing candidates
  - Currently making “over promises” without adequate PM capacity
- Software Engineer (payments-focused)
  - Can complement PM if less cross-border experience
  - Alternative: experienced engineer paired with less specialized PM
- Market Leads
  - Spanish-speaking Latin America focus
  - Opportunistic Brazil coverage (Portuguese speakers with Spanish capability)
  - Africa GM/sales role (Nigeria/Kenya preferred over South Africa)
  - Several candidates in second interviews for Africa role
- Marketing role deprioritized
  - Considering contractor/agency over full-time hire
  - Need quick execution on backlog, fundraising PR
  - Galaxy PR handling launch materials, separate agency for video

### Sales & Customer Strategy

- Current challenge: low conversion from leads to closed deals
  - Good lead generation but poor closing rates
  - 80% failure rate in making customers more profitable
- Root causes identified:
  - Product not delivering 10x improvement over status quo
  - Customers face switching inertia
  - No competitor threats - main competitor is “doing nothing”
- Recommended approach shift:
  - Focus 80% effort on customers with urgent, immediate pain
  - Deprioritize big logo hunting until product delivers more value
  - Save enterprise logos for pre-fundraise momentum (summer timing)
- US bank partnerships in progress
  - Conversations with Anchorage, USAT, Aaronborn
  - Focus on crypto-friendly smaller banks, not major institutions
  - Currently just account opening, not customer relationships

### Revenue & Fundraising Timeline

- Current metrics: Hit $2B accumulated volume (second billion in 3 months vs 6 months for first)
- Revenue growth target using “annualized run rate revenue”
- 2-year runway at current $2M annual burn rate
- No immediate fundraising pressure - driven by momentum needs
- Estimated fundraising timing: May 2026 (after hiring ramp-up)
- Polygon subsidies declining as revenue percentage

### Next Steps

- Elliot: Draft prospective investor update using existing template
  - Include 2025 metrics and hiring needs for talent sourcing
  - Target 200-person distribution for potential hiring leads
- Matt: Repost product roles on LinkedIn, focus on company target list
- Jack: Provide HubSpot access for sales pipeline management
  - Share investor update template
  - Connect with Column (Jeremy Brenner) via Will Hockey introduction
- Team: Prioritize operational excellence over logo acquisition next 2-3 months

title: Elliot Storey and Hunter Worland
summary:
### Hunter Worland & NEA Overview

- Investor at New Enterprise Associates (NEA) - global multistage VC
- Focus: Fintech strategy, seed to Series C deals
- Check sizes: $500K to $200M across fund
- Current fund: $6.5B, ending soon with new fund launching in months
- Deal pace: 2-3 monthly on tech team, consensus-driven IC process
- Geographic focus: 75% US, active globally (Brazil, Europe)
- Investment model: Reserve significant capital for follow-ons after initial investment

### Investment Priorities & Portfolio Performance

- **2026 Priority**: Major stablecoin infrastructure investment (“will consider 2026 a failure” without big swing)
- **Current Portfolio Highlights**:
  - Slash: Going to Series C at \~$1.5B valuation
  - Latitude: Raising Series A, coming out of stealth
  - Brazil fintech: Doubled revenue in 6 months since investment
- **Investment Areas**: Stablecoin infrastructure, AI for financial services, verticalized SaaS
- Price sensitivity on AI deals due to high markups

### Backbone Portfolio Alignment

- **Stablecoin Companies Discussed**:
  - XFX: $10M seed led by Horn, Oak, Castle Island
  - Checker Finance: $6M Galaxy-led round (confidential)
  - Cedar Money: B2B payments, CEO Benji Feinberg (ex-Behalf)
  - Trace Finance: Brazil-based (Hunter knows well, met multiple times)
- **Double Sharp**: Liquidity network for stablecoin companies
  - VanEck leading with $2M equity + $15M credit facility
  - Round currently being finalized
- Hunter expressed strong interest in XFX intro and investor updates for portfolio companies

### Next Steps

- Elliot to check Double Sharp round timing for potential Hunter involvement
- Add Hunter to relevant investor update lists
- Potential NYC meeting with Matt Burton (Backbone partner, in city Wednesdays)
- Ongoing deal flow sharing with 2-page memos as screening tool

title: Pure Math AI: Meeting with David Beaver
summary:
### David’s Background & Current Ventures

- Left NYC after Covid, now in Portland, Oregon (4+ years)
- Currently running two parallel businesses:
  - Third Wire Asset Management: equity-only role for 2.5 years helping launch managed futures/CTA funds into private wealth channel
  - Pure Math AI: data science/AI consulting with Japanese-American mathematician Sean, targeting finance sector applications

### Pure Math AI Product & Capabilities

- Built comprehensive database by scraping entire SEC/IAPD and FINRA BrokerCheck
  - Every RIA registered with SEC/state
  - All broker dealers in FINRA system
  - \~400k registered representatives
- Dual database structure:
  1. Traditional database for standard queries
  2. Chroma database with embedded ADV documents for semantic search
- AI-powered chatbot system enables:
  - Company profiling from websites/decks
  - ICP identification and targeting
  - Automated prospect list generation
  - Campaign planning for financial services sales
- Current state: functional prototype, basic UX, connector to Perplexity

### Strategic Partnership Opportunity

- Perfect fit for Pluto’s channel-driven go-to-market strategy
- System can identify all financial advisors using platforms like iCapital
- Enables targeted campaigns to influence channel partners’ client bases
- David seeking strategic partner to:
  - Fund continued development
  - Build specific workflows for different use cases
  - Support go-to-market execution
- Pure Math needs funding/partnership - currently bootstrapped

### Next Steps

- Elliot to review demo and provide feedback on messaging
- Elliot setting up meeting with Neil (Pluto CEO) - likely \~10 days out (Neil currently in Dubai)
- David will send contact info and follow-up materials

title: Backbone + Ocrolus catch up
summary:
### Ocrolus Business Overview

- $50M ARR across three business lines
  - SMB lending: $30M ARR, 40% growth (flagship business)
  - Mortgage: $15M ARR, doubled in last year (fastest growing)
  - Platform: $7-8M ARR (enables third-party solutions)
- 160 mortgage customers (80 banks, 80 non-banks)
- Majority of mortgage customers use 100% of origination volume
- Currently break-even, burned <$100K in December

### 2026 Growth Strategy

- Target: >$75M ARR (50%+ growth)
- Mortgage business expected to double again to $25-30M ARR
  - Average labor cost to process loan: $7,500
  - Current Ocrolus cost: $20 per application
  - Building conditioning suite to charge $100 per application
  - Signed 85 new mortgage customers in 2025
- SMB lending: 30-40% growth expected
- AI tailwinds driving C-level directives to automate

### Fundraising Plans

- Mid-year process targeting $150M+ (half primary, half secondary)
- Primary: Growth initiatives and balance sheet strengthening
- Secondary: Early investor buyouts and employee tender offer
- Current balance sheet: \~$15M cash
- Series C investors likely to participate pro rata
- Oak supportive of continued growth

### M&A Strategy Discussion

- Strong recommendation to incorporate M&A into fundraising narrative
- Target companies: $15-20M revenue, break-even but VC-constrained
- Examples discussed: Capchase/Verta acquisition, Mundi (trade factoring)
- Benefits for fundraising story:
  1. Demonstrates controlled growth path independent of macro
  2. Enables larger check deployment for investors
  3. Potential multiple arbitrage opportunities
- Mortgage market still 50-60% of normalized volume (coiled spring potential)

### Next Steps

- February: Annual report release for Series D fund outreach
- Start 6-month investor communication cadence
- Explore small M&A opportunities to establish track record
- Leverage DC connections for mortgage industry regulatory changes
- Follow up on JP Morgan Chase Newco partnership opportunity

title: Backbone + Allan Erskine catch up
summary:
### Allan’s Distributed Proof Technology

- Built bilateral proof system since September after hedge fund trading desk wound down
- Addresses settlement pain in FX/FCM space through distributed ledger alternative
  - No consortium building or network setup required
  - Each party uses own AWS infrastructure with secure adapters
  - Cross-signs records with timestamps (NIST, blockchain block heights)
  - Handles 25,000 records/second with value conservation proofs
- Background: JP Morgan triparty repo experience, tokenized collateral platform work
- Current status: Delaware company, weapons-grade research software being productized

### Target Markets & Use Cases

- FCM (Futures Commission Merchants) bilateral reconciliation pain
  - Manual spreadsheets, FTP drops for settlement
  - Multiple settlement legs: stablecoin network, remittance network, FCM, transactor
  - Hundreds of billions to trillions in trapped margin globally
- Active leads:
  1. Big Tony - UK electricity markets (15-minute cash settlement)
  2. Eric - supply chain/lithium mining (crypto graveyard recovery)
- Potential portfolio company fits: XFX, Checker, Diameter
  - XFX founding story centered on trapped capital problem
  - 10sec signing contract with XFX - potential bilateral implementation

### Business Model & Next Steps

- Software licensing model, white-label ready
- Standalone attestation capability with network effects at scale
- Dog-fooding with AWS security proofs (3 months admin account unused)
- Allan to connect directly with Jason at XFX
- Elliot will share Allan’s overview with Checker team
- Backbone to determine internal next steps with Matt

title: Backbone Investment Committee
summary:
### Meeting Structure Discussion

- First formal investment committee meeting format established
- Decided to analyze opportunities using structured framework:
  1. Company discussion with key metrics/status
  2. How Backbone can help the company
  3. Market observations and broader principles
  4. Portfolio construction implications
- Need investment memos as input or output for future meetings
- Plan to record decisions/opinions to build track record

### Lava (Mitchell) - Series A Discussion

- Norwest offering $50M valuation (pre vs post TBD)
  - Jordan (VP at Norwest) leading, treating him like partner
  - Norwest allocating $25-50M to this VP based on Rain/Stablecore success
  - All existing investors (Lear Hippo, Harlem Ventures, Westbound) want to participate
- Current traction assessment:
  - 5-person team, well-capitalized
  - Early stage: first 10-15 companies onboarding
  - No product-market fit confirmed yet - insufficient data
  - Pipeline shows 3-4 mid-market contracts, nothing approaching six figures
- Key concerns:
  - Ahead of commercial traction for $50M valuation
  - Mitchell restricting engagement universe vs aggressive expansion
  - Hiring pace too slow - needs salesperson, ops person
  - Product-focused founder reluctant to scale team before PMF clarity
- Backbone helping with:
  - Round dynamics - reaching out to First Mark, Oak, F Prime for competitive tension
  - Target: push valuation from $50M to $60M
  - All contacts are refreshed conversations, not net new
- Market observation: AI/fintech companies commanding high multiples with limited traction (FOMO-driven)

### Rain - Potential Buyout Opportunity

- $50M revenue, profitable, growing 20-30% annually (40-45% in strong sales years)
- Structural problems creating opportunity:
  - Board turnover: lead investor contact left firm, new contact didn’t want deal
  - QED board member (Adams Conrad) leaving QED this year
  - Invis board member already replaced
  - CEO checked out, living in Brazil after secondary sale
  - Management team considering quitting - no incentive plan
- All existing investors tapped out, can’t invest more
- COO (Fred) wants to step up as CEO - Backbone recommendation
- Potential 10-15M check could “name your price”
- M&A options explored:
  - Should merge with Zazoon (Israeli company) but personality conflicts
  - Daily Pay natural combination but timing/price disagreements
- Leverage buyout structure preferred over VC approach
- Broker dealer status would clean up transaction economics

### Diameter Execution & Fundraising

- Deal executed: 50 bps equity + 2% warrant
- Cross-border payments infrastructure serving stablecoin companies
- Strong recent momentum:
  - 170% revenue growth 2024-2025
  - 3 new clients signed last 30 days, 2 more pending
  - $500K+ contracted 2026 revenue already secured
  - $10B+ transaction volume processed 2025
- Founder background: World Bank, Haiti reconstruction, mission-driven
- Fundraising prep:
  - Contour Ventures immediate interest after updated materials
  - Target: $10M raise at $50M pre-money valuation
  - First draft memo due this week
  - Need to develop founder’s 5-minute intro story
  - Coaching required: tightly wound operator, needs to loosen presentation style

### Investment Strategy & Market Opportunities

- Portfolio construction discussion: balance between FOMO deals vs traction-based investments
- Expanding beyond traditional VC into buyout/restructuring opportunities
- Precious metals/mining sector interest:
  - Chris at Double Sharp successful with silver positions
  - Copper potentially next opportunity via junior miners
  - Sam Elig meeting scheduled (Jan 27) - South America mining/lithium expert
  - Tokenization angle for future Backbone positioning
- February 2025 portfolio update planned to highlight Backbone value-add with founders

title: Call Jared
summary:
### Dominique Relationship Dynamics

- Jared observes defensiveness when Elliot asks process questions about design partnerships
  - She interprets questions as checking her work vs. gathering information for fundraising positioning
  - Goes “on tilt” when sales process questioned - similar to criticism of technical architecture
- Root cause: lack of visibility into Backbone’s value proposition
  - Hasn’t seen VC spreadsheets, relationship mapping, or strategic approach
  - Questions why give “big chunk of company” without clear differentiation
  - Wants concrete examples of unique value vs. generic “we’re an accelerant” messaging

### Gender Dynamics in Tech Context

- Jared notes women in tech are “incredibly attuned” to patronizing energy
  - Dominique doesn’t react similarly to Matt or Jason
  - Triggered by perceived “let me tell you how to do sales, honey” tone
- Recommendation: reframe from criticism to collaborative discovery
  - “Sounds like you’ve got it” approach vs. direct questioning
  - Filter feedback through Jared when needed

### Proposed Solutions

- Elliot will finalize VC target list for review
  - Address Dominique’s concern about fintech over-concentration
  - Leverage existing relationships (SoFi) for customer introductions
- Connect Dominique with portfolio CEOs for value validation
- Include Matt in future conversations given Dominique’s respect for his background
- Jason to strategize best engagement approach given his positive relationship dynamic

### Market Intelligence Opportunity Discussion

- Repo monitoring for competitive intelligence
  - Monitor competitor commits/pushes for strategic insights
  - Example: Stripe tracking Adyen development priorities
  - Lightweight implementation: email domain search + change notifications
- Knowledge graph as separate licensable asset
  - Similar to LinkedIn’s economic graph value for Microsoft acquisition
  - Multiple monetization paths from same data foundation
- Stripe meeting momentum: Scott McVicar responded within 24 hours requesting immediate follow-up

### Next Steps

- Elliot: finalize and share VC list with Jared
- Jared: strategize with Jason on Dominique engagement approach
- Explore repo intelligence concept with Stripe and SoFi design partners
- Consider knowledge graph separation for licensing opportunities

title: Quick Sync on Autar Progress
summary:
### Company Health Check

- Dominique and Jared report good progress overall despite Jared’s desire for faster pace
- Multiple design partnerships in pipeline, making steady product development progress
- Jared’s extensive network providing strong Fortune 500 enterprise connections
  - Former colleagues now distributed across major companies
  - Network providing clear path to enterprise-level validation
- Dominique testing competitive positioning
  - Attended founder event, challenged to replicate 6 months of work with Claude
  - Using this as validation exercise for product differentiation

### Design Partnership Progress

- On track for 4-5 partnerships signed this month (stretch goal as of January 23rd)
  - 1 partnership already signed
  - 2 partnerships in active paperwork stage (paperwork described as “light”)
  - 1 additional opportunity Jared can close “fairly easily”
  - Several expectation-setting meetings completed
- Target ICP: Companies with reliance on or maintenance of open source repositories
- Strategy: Build outside “enterprise garden” while earning enterprise-level respect
- Focus on product-market fit validation through design partnerships

### Key Partnership Opportunities

- Stripe: Primary contact Leasha (former LinkedIn colleague with Dominique)
  - Runs all IT infrastructure at Stripe
  - Strong product-market fit validation in initial meeting
  - Next step: Meeting with Scott McVicker (C-S-I-C-K-E-R) who runs all internal tools
  - McVicker has signature authority for purchases
- SoFi: Direct contact with head of internal tooling
  - Person responsible for internal tool purchasing decisions
- Netflix: Third major target in pipeline
- Positioning strategy: Request $10K-100K POC investments to ensure skin in the game
  - Rationale: “Drop in bucket” for companies managing $10M+ budgets
  - Goal: Move beyond free pilots to paid proof-of-concepts

### Fundraising Strategy & Timeline

- Current financial position: Strong runway of 1+ years minimum
  - Potential to extend to 2+ years if needed by tapping additional reserves
  - Raise would be purely for acceleration, not survival
- Target parameters:
  - Raise amount: \~$10M
  - Maximum dilution: 15%
  - Primary uses: Employee compensation and infrastructure/cloud costs
  - Team scaling through equity rather than immediate cash hires
- Timeline flexibility: Could execute by April but no pressure
  - Taking Backbone’s December advice to stay in stealth until ready
  - No VC conversations until clear growth trajectory established
- Minimum threshold for fundraising: 2+ premium enterprise customers willing to strongly advocate on investor calls by March 1-15

### VC Partnership Evaluation

- Dominique’s specific requirements for Backbone partnership:
  - Detailed list of 30-50 target VC firms with strong rationale
  - Deal history showing successful placements with similar companies
  - Fund thesis alignment for infrastructure/AI agents companies (not fintech)
  - Specific partner relationships and intro mechanisms
  - Clear differentiation beyond standard fundraising services
- Current uncertainty: Dominique has extensive fundraising experience but lacks visibility into Backbone’s unique network value
- Oak HC/FT identified as potential strong fit
  - Known relationship through Jason
  - Fund focus: Healthcare and fintech
  - Recently formalizing AI agents investment thesis
- Reference point: Lava extension example (71 firms contacted for seed, 40+ for extension)

### Next Steps

- Elliot to deliver comprehensive VC analysis document
  - Target delivery: Today or Monday latest
  - Include 30-50+ firms with detailed rationale
  - Show fund fit, deal history, and relationship depth
- Autar team continues design partnership execution
  - Goal: March customer advocates ready for investor calls
  - Continue building enterprise validation pipeline

title: Elliot Storey <> Igor Bazay
summary:
### Company Overview & Product

- Roya provides central data layer for enterprises to onboard and manage AI agents at scale
- Eliminates need for internal teams to build data pipelines for each new agent
- Acts as data fabric between compliance stack and federated data structures
- Agent procurement portal allows easy onboarding - “log in, onboard agent, go live”

### Traction & Pipeline

- $400K ARR by end of month (8 months since going live in April)
- $10M enterprise and mid-market pipeline
- Key clients:
  - Unilever: Going live across 4 teams (beauty, wellness, personal care Canada, global enterprise architecture)
  - Publicis: World’s largest media agency, partnering for client Meta and other capabilities
  - Mon Château: Referring new brands
- Client referrals accelerating: Unilever referred to LVMH and EL Catarton this week

### Technical Implementation & Use Cases

- 3-week implementation cycle at Unilever
- Flexible integration approach - meets clients where they are vs. imposing digital transformation
- Connects to owned databases (SharePoint, Snowflake, Databricks) and third-party platforms (Facebook, HubSpot, Salesforce)
- Use cases span both internal and customer-facing agents:
  - Internal: Creative briefs, content marketing, performance marketing, supply chain, logistics
  - Customer-facing: Customer success, pricing agents

### Go-to-Market Strategy

- Targeting consumer-facing enterprises further ahead on AI adoption curve
- Two distribution models:
  1. Direct enterprise sales (Unilever, Mon Château)
  2. Partnership distribution (Publicis bundles for clients)
- Buyers: Business leads at enterprises, VPs of capability/innovation at agencies
- Enterprise-first approach creates network effects - agents wanting Fortune 50 access must use Roya
- Still in stealth mode (no public website until Series A)

### Fundraising & Next Steps

- Currently raising friends & family extension: $1.2M at $12M post-money (20% discount), $600K capacity remaining
- Paused $4M seed round when Unilever contract materialized - waiting for better metrics before institutional round
- Planning larger round in April after deploying to existing pipeline
- Unilever alone projected as $2.9M annual client ($30M agent spending through platform)
- Seeking help with European network and Fortune 50 introductions
- Potential NYC meeting with Matt (Backbone partner, Orchard founder)

title: Elliot + Oivind
summary:
### Platform Evolution

- Moving from reactive firefighting to proactive operating system
  - Marry reactive (putting out fires) with proactive (preventing fires while creating positive effects)
  - Data problem: pulling unstructured data to minimize manual submission lift
  - Portfolio companies struggle with continual data submission
- Current approach focuses on progress against goals rather than hard numbers
  - Hard coded goals for each company tracked quasi-manually
  - Health indicators correlate back to goal progress
  - Weighted against portfolio value/ownership levels
- Timeline: prototype running for Backbone by end of next month
- Architecture: two-vector system
  - Internal: portfolio companies, firms, investors, rounds, deals, people
  - External: market pipeline tracking for new deals

### VC Workflow Insights (Oivind’s perspective)

- Portfolio management differs significantly by fund size/stage
  - Oak speaks with CEOs weekly/bi-weekly, sometimes daily
  - Strong communication lines make reactive/proactive easier
  - Partners sit on boards with deep relationships
- New deals vs portfolio split roughly 50/50 importance
- Most valuable workflow improvement: proactive deal management
  - Discovery and initial research for triage/prioritization
  - Being proactive to win deals
- Network management critical pain point
  - Need automated intro recommendations from network database
  - Current manual process: weekly Granola review for promised follow-ups
  - Ideal: tool suggests 5 relevant people for customer intros with draft emails

### Pipeline Challenges

- VC pipeline fundamentally different from sales pipeline
  - Can’t identify interesting companies until after conversation
  - Starts much wider, less defined ICP
  - Target companies change over time based on market learning
  - Example: AI compliance thesis may only have 1 company that matters
- Fund strategies vary:
  - Some focus on 10 target companies annually (high risk if none convert)
  - Others maintain broader pipeline approach
- Data coordination gap between deal teams and LP reporting systems
  - No good solution connecting daily conversations to quarterly LP decks
  - Finance team collects company data separately

### Next Steps

- Continue conversation tomorrow (Oivind available via text)

title: Norwest investment round planning at 10M with 12% dilution
summary:
### Investment Round Structure

- Total round size: $10M with 12% total dilution
- Post-money valuation: $75M
- Norwest investment breakdown:
  - $7.5M check for 10% ownership
  - Existing investors: $2.5M pro rata participation
- Targeting 12% dilution cap (negotiable from 12.5%)

### Existing Investor Outreach Strategy

- Need to contact all existing investors before Norwest negotiations
- Talk track for existing investors:
  - Announce Norwest interest and terms
  - Confirm pro rata participation preferences
  - Clarify safe vs. priced round structure
  - Prioritize existing investors for participation
- Must verify super pro rata rights with Westbound

### Potential Additional Investors

- Oak Capital consideration
  - Previously passive engagement
  - Backbone can handle outreach coordination
- First Prime doing current work
- F Prime potential inclusion
- Decision criteria: incremental value vs. complexity
- Would require increased round size for new participants

### Next Steps

- Mitchell to make 4 investor calls
- Verify Westbound super pro rata rights
- Collect existing investor participation preferences
- Schedule Norwest negotiation meeting after investor feedback
- Lunch meeting planned for next week

title: Series A fundraising strategy and valuation planning with Mitchell
summary:
### Series C Extension Terms

- Norwest check size: $5-10M at 10% dilution
  - Super pro rata rights to reach 15% in next round
  - Scaling mechanism: reduce check to $5M if $10M implies too high valuation
- Target valuation discussion:
  - Mitchell wants Series A north of $100M
  - Low end acceptable: $66M
  - Sweet spot target: $80M (avoids heartburn, reasonable 4X multiple)
  - $100M risk: potentially just vanity pricing

### Strategic Positioning

- Current round anchors Series A valuation
- Need mathematical scenarios to justify pricing
  - Growth metrics backing
  - Business rationale for chosen number
- Norwest relationship considerations:
  - Jordan relationship valued
  - Proximity to Rain portfolio important
  - Default: maintain relationship if terms reasonable

### Leverage Strategy Options

- Norwest squeeze approach:
  1. Don’t burn relationship unless willing to execute
  2. Consider who worth burning them for
  3. Use leverage for future commitments vs current optimization
- Alternative: $8M check creates room to fill round with another investor
  - Could induce competitive dynamics
  - Risk: may lose Norwest without guaranteed replacement

### Market Reality Check

- Current business stage: not traditional Series A metrics
- Different market would have been Series A check size
- Focus: let market set terms rather than chase specific numbers
- 10% at $70M valuation feels comfortable to Mitchell

### Next Steps

- Tomorrow 1:30 PM meeting scheduled
  - Mitchell, Burton (in person), Elliot (remote)
  - Location: Mitchell’s office
  - Agenda: scenario modeling with calculator/math review
- Burton meeting Ryan for lunch at 1 PM, joining after
- Prepare growth metrics and business rationale for $80M target

title: Backbone + Lava weekly
summary:
### Market Size Strategy for Norwest Pitch

- Positioning $4.5T market by 2030 vs current $1T SaaS with wrong pricing model
  - Focus on 2030 numbers (4% = $180B opportunity) rather than current state
  - Emphasize enabling category growth, not just capturing existing market
  - Frame as 7-year investment horizon matching fund timeline
- Key messaging: seat-based pricing broken for AI agents
  - Good agents require fewer seats, creating pricing mismatch
  - $40B current opportunity growing to $400B future revenue potential

### Investor Psychology & Meeting Tactics

- Jeff’s background: Dartmouth/Stanford, Admeld connection, Forbes Midas list
  - Ask targeted questions early to maintain room attention
  - Wells Fargo LP relationship - checking strategic vs arms-length involvement
  - Focus on non-Jordan/Nikhil concerns (they’re already friendly)
- Meeting approach:
  - Start conversational before slides, use “B button” to blank presentation
  - Ask about most successful portfolio engagements at end
  - Determine AUM (current × 5 = target portfolio exit size)
  - Need $10B enterprise value story to be significant investment

### Revenue/Growth Positioning

- Primary KPI: organizations using Lava Build or Lava Monetize products
  - 20% week-over-week growth in orgs on platform
  - Revenue lever available but not current focus - investing in usage growth
  - Compare to Stripe’s early growth-with-customers model
- Pipeline questions expected
  - Backing into Series B requirements (2-year timeline)
  - Emphasize real payment processing vs pilot-heavy AI competitors
  - Payment revenue validates underlying business health

### Partnership Strategy & AI Tools Integration

- Two-pronged GTM approach:
  1. Self-serve flywheel for long-tail customers
  2. Strategic partnerships with legacy processors + AI coding agents
- AI agent opportunity:
  - LLMs choosing payment tools during code generation
  - Small companies (heavy AI tool users) become enterprise customers
  - Content strategy for model training/comparison pages
  - Supabase integration priority for developer ecosystem

### Next Steps

- Mitchell: Text Jordan about Wells Fargo strategic involvement before meeting
- Mitchell: 3 PM pitch meeting with Norwest
- Post-meeting: Send Jeff follow-up note regardless of outcome
- Follow-up call scheduled for tomorrow morning

title: Backbone + Oak
summary:
### Oak HC/FT Investment Strategy Updates

- Moving toward more flexible approach on fintech investments
  - Less constrained on initial check size and stage
  - Focus on best companies in thesis areas vs strict stage requirements
- Healthcare team has more growth equity/PE opportunities with larger checks
  - Allows fintech side to take more venture risk
  - Won’t do high volume - selective approach with deep involvement
- Special sleeve remains at 10% of fund (\~$100M)
  - Told LPs wouldn’t exceed 5% (10% of fintech allocation)
  - Enables smaller checks with simplified plumbing
- Market dynamics shifted significantly
  - Everything gets preempted now - no traditional Series A/B processes
  - Front-running top-tier VCs (Andreessen, General Catalyst)
  - Widely shopped deals likely negatively selected
  - Need to focus on 10 target names vs reactive approach

### Backbone Strategy Evolution

- New warrant structure for early-stage companies
  - Warrant to buy 2-3% at \~$200M valuation threshold
  - 10-20% discount above threshold for companies they incubate
  - Founders eager to accept given pre-revenue status
- Diversification strategy through SPVs
  - Plan to raise capital later this year for warrant exercise
  - May bring in VCs or family offices for individual company exposure
  - Focus on better-performing portfolio companies
- Portfolio performing well across board
  - Everyone grew and raised capital last year
  - Older fintech cohort consolidating/winding down

###

title: Sidekick Partners
summary:
### Backbone Context & Lucius Introduction

- Backbone: 4-person venture studio incubating fintech/AI startups
  - 15-16 months operating, 10-15 portfolio companies
  - 7-8 net new companies created from pre-formation
  - Focus on embedded, high-touch support for early-stage founders
- Lucius positioning: ERP 3.0 for AI era
  - Targeting 1-25 employee VC-backed AI startups
  - Embedding before CFO hire (CEO still doing payroll stage)
  - Differentiated from Relic/competitors who sell to existing finance teams

### Sidekick Partners Background

- 12-13 years operating, 8 people in NYC
- Investment focus areas:
  1. Technology: healthcare IT, fintech, vertical software
  2. Consumer: food/beverage, fashion/beauty CPG
  3. Services: professional services (strategy, accounting)
- Recent exit: Ledger Way CPA firm rollup
  - Backed founder rolling up sub-scale CPA firms serving SMBs
  - 40% equity stake, supported inorganic growth strategy
  - Quick turnaround sale to Connecticut buyout firm

### Lucius Business Model Discussion

- Customer segment: 1-10 employee venture-backed startups at \~$1.2M ARR
- Current traction: \~15 entities using product in various stages
- Pricing structure:
  - Transaction-based revenue currently
  - Platform SaaS fee planned within 30 days
- Distribution strategy:
  - VCs as partners
  - Embedding with fractional CFO groups
  - PLG self-serve onboarding
- Competitive landscape: Manual QuickBooks until system breaks

### Recent Funding & Timeline

- Raised money Q4 on $10M SAFE
  - Opportunistic round from interested investors
  - Using funds to build more traction after summer feedback
- Next raise planned: End Q1/beginning Q2
  - 4 months of additional proof points needed
  - Market feedback: need more usage/customers before institutional round

### Backbone Portfolio Overview

- Crypto/stablecoin infrastructure: 3-5 companies
  - Cross-border B2B payments focus
  - Companies include XFX, Lava Payments
- Agentic AI applications:
  - Maintenance layer for agentic code
  - Various enterprise AI agent management tools
- Alternative fintech:

### Next Steps

- Elliot: Send updated 2-page Lucius memo to Hayden
- Elliot: Add Sidekick to investor update distribution for Backbone portfolio
- Hayden: Email Ryan directly to schedule coffee meeting
  - Available Tuesday or Thursday next week in NYC
- Elliot: Give Ryan heads up about Hayden’s outreach

title: Elliot + Nick
summary:
### Backbone Fundraising Progress

- LinkedIn launch happening Friday/weekend - key milestone
- Moving toward capital raising this year after removing previous caveats
- Team expansion with Alex, Justin becoming more integrated
  - Jason Pate formally engaged, joining planning meetings
  - Bi-weekly management structure established
- Core portfolio: \~10 companies, majority true Backbone incubations
  - No companies in shutdown mode
  - 1-2 at risk (including Checker post-round)
  - Rest showing green metrics with increased marks

### Primary VC Structure & Model

- 60-person team ($2-300M more AUM than Fin, but much larger staff)
  - 12 investment professionals
  - 40+ platform staff: BD, talent, hiring, corp dev, design
- Nick’s remit expanded significantly from Finn:
  - Financial services (broad mandate)
  - Enterprise software
  - Go-to-market tools (sales tech, CRM, customer support)
- Embedding model: Primary staff work directly in portfolio companies
  - Recruiters embedded for 6 months at cost
  - Sales team members (25-26 year olds) rotate between portfolio companies
  - Currently hiring 3 people for sales embedding team

### Platform Evolution Strategy

- Origin: “Why no Andreessen Horowitz for New York?”
- Initial focus: East Coast dominance, avoiding Bay Area competition
- Recent shift: Considering Bay Area expansion to compete for tier-1 deals
  - Fund size evolution from \~$150M to potential $500M seed funds
  - Recognition that seed market exploded - “tens of billions deployed at this stage”

### Portfolio Management Challenges

- Finn experience: 130 companies, Nick managing 46 - pure firefighting mode
- Primary approach: Quarterly/bi-monthly 4-hour sessions
  - Red/Green/Orange company grading
  - Focus only on reds and greens in meetings
  - Framework: Material changes, key risks, “glass balls” (cannot drop items), value-driving activities
- Industry-wide problem: Excel spreadsheets still most effective tool

### VC CRM Development Discussion

- Elliot building AI-powered CRM prototype for early-stage VCs
- Key features envisioned:
  - Meeting transcription with automatic extraction of risks, next steps
  - Goal tracking tied to company health metrics
  - Proactive task suggestions beyond reactive reporting
  - Integration with Granola, G Suite, WhatsApp
- Primary’s interest: Would adopt VC-specific CRM with meeting transcription
- Market gap: Existing tools (Affinity, Salesforce) inadequate for VC workflows

### Next Steps

- Elliot to send Jack’s CV to Jason Galman for Primary sales team role
- Nick to share Primary’s portfolio management framework screenshots

title: Pluto + Backbone weekly
summary:
### Deal Progress & Pipeline

- Alexis Ohanian signed Christmas morning for $19.6M deal
  - Neel negotiating with credit fund at their Christmas party (entire investor committee present)
  - Credit fund demanded ridiculous last-minute terms: 25% sweep formula on every dollar from particular assets
  - Alexis unhappy with last-minute changes but committed and needs the money
  - $400k in legal costs accumulated (mostly due to Cooley incompetence)
  - Neel put up $75k retainer but gets paid back when loan funds
  - Legal opinion landing today, then definitive docs ready for funding
- Chris Farmer (Signal Fire) bespoke loan opportunity
  - $15M at S+7 pricing for fund of funds platform targeting VCs
  - Going through divorce, needs money quickly
  - Converting from bespoke to platform opportunity given his VC connections
  - Competing offer from Turbine VC (access liquidity without selling stake)
  - Pluto’s offer superior and moving much faster than competitor
- Strong post-launch momentum driving inbounds
  - 100+ inbounds since launch with good press coverage
  - TV interview tomorrow morning on [WealthManagementTV.com](http://WealthManagementTV.com) (30-minute taped interview, syndicated in coming weeks)
  - PitchBook and Crunchbase interviews scheduled for tomorrow
  - [WealthManagement.com](http://WealthManagement.com) piece most impactful (what all advisors use)
  - Media kit prepared and being distributed
- Press release coordination issue with Moonfare
  - Neel cleared with Allocate, Apollo, Hamilton Lane but forgot Moonfare
  - Moonfare PR team reached out asking who approved
  - Had to re-brief and remove Moonfare from press release
  - CEO apology sent, no major damage

### Team Changes & Hiring Priorities

- Brian (CTO) exit completed mid-December
  - Had conversation while Neel in Paris
  - Wants shares only, no severance demands
  - Last day this Friday, exit documentation ready for execution
  - Gets zero if doesn’t execute exit docs
  - Team already communicated about departure
- Jason promoted to interim CTO role
  - Second most senior engineer on team
  - Not made permanent CTO immediately - Neel transparent about needing to see leadership from him
  - Previously deferred decisions to Brian, now excited by opportunity
  - Will evaluate performance before permanent promotion
- Chief of Staff/Swiss Army Knife hire progressing
  - Two shortlisted candidates identified:
    1. Goldman analyst who reached out based on press release
    2. Former Portage analyst (worked on Pluto’s pre-seed) now at different startup
  - Both getting one-pager case study this Wednesday
  - Decision to follow based on case study performance
- Critical senior engineer need
  - Sid (Elliot’s referral) didn’t interview well with team, rejected
  - Mid-level engineer ad posted but senior engineer priority
  - Requesting network introductions from Backbone team
- Vincent signed and confirmed
  - Currently on holiday, returning Wednesday
  - Strong hire that’s working out well

### Strategic Priorities & Challenges

- Four immediate burning issues requiring resolution:
  1. **Templatized legal documentation**
    - Engaged Joseph (former Apollo partner, now Paul Weiss partner)
    - Runs private credit globally for Paul Weiss
    - Apollo and Hamilton Lane trust him and his work
    - Writing templatized docs but moving slowly
  2. **Moonfare/UniCredit partnership conflict**
    - Two partners fighting, creating operational friction
    - Neel catching up with UniCredit tomorrow to resolve
    - May need to visit in person next month to sort out issues
  3. **Team hiring** (covered above)
  4. **Regulatory structure - partner bank requirement**
    - CBW Bank term sheet secured (not most reputable option)
    - Patriot Bank preferred target (charges 10 basis points)
    - Former Uptiq co-founder now Patriot Bank president reached out
    - Understands competitive landscape and Pluto’s model perfectly
- Andreessen Horowitz mega-opportunity driving urgency
  - $26M NAV opportunity with 335 LPs
  - All four burning issues must be solved to execute this deal
  - Hamilton Lane already offered S+4.50 terms (very attractive)
  - Success would create repeatable process template
  - Could target 10 of 335 clients with zero incremental legal costs
  - Would enable pitching every PE fund and VC fund with proven model
- Capital raising strategy shift toward customer-first approach
  - Prefer big three VCs (A16Z, Sequoia, GV) as customers before investors
  - Target their wealth management arms: Andreessen’s arm, Sequoia Heritage, GV Wealth
  - A16Z just announced $15B across funds, creating opportunity
  - David Haber still fintech/lending guy at A16Z (plus Mark Andrew in NY)
  - Strategy: help them build firm capabilities, not just provide capital
- Current financial position: $7.1M in bank
- Goals: Q1 target $30M volume, Q4 target $500-800M depending on partnerships
- Marketing infrastructure locked down
  - Patrick brought in for marketing support
  - In-house design capabilities established
  - Website leads feeding directly into CRM with automatic drip campaigns
  - Follow-up marketing discussion scheduled for Thursday

### Competitive Intelligence & Market Updates

- Turbine VC (competitor) offering inferior terms and slower execution on Chris Farmer deal
- Juno/Waldo pivot story (Jeff and Ryan from former Gatsby)
  - Started with KYC business, added Treasury business
  - Treasury growing so fast they’re shutting down KYC business
  - Operating costs down to $7,500/month
  - Looking for KYC business buyer
- Norwest reactivating fintech investments
  - Had huge win with Rain (stablecoin to credit card) seed investment
  - Now seeing fewer companies than fund slots (preemption environment)
  - Random crypto fund reached out asking about allocation availability

### Next Steps

- Neel meeting Jordan (Norwest) at 3pm today
- Motive meeting tomorrow, Portage meeting Wednesday
  - 14-page update document prepared for both meetings
  - Quarterly informal board catch-ups planned going forward
  - Primary ask: team hiring support and introductions
- Marketing pipeline follow-up call Thursday with Elliot
- Investor update distribution (hit January 1st deadline)
- Jason (Plaid connection) to provide Portage intelligence through advisor relationship
- Secondary liquidity consideration for future rounds (not immediate priority)

title: Elliot+James
summary:
### James’s Background & Career Journey

- Father successful entrepreneur (multiple 8-figure exits + bankruptcy experience)
- Intentional career progression through funding stages:
  - Accenture: Ecosystem Adventures team (2 years, promoted in 9 months)
  - Currency Cloud: Business development consultant (6 months)
  - Fidel: First commercial hire, seed to Series B journey
  - Divido: White label buy-now-pay-later API (1 year)
  - Monite: Employee #8, grew 0 to £4M ARR, 85-90% personally contributed
    - Spoke to 2,500+ platforms about finops workflows
    - Built team across US/UK/Europe
    - Board observer on senior leadership team

### Dolfinai Current Status & Traction

- Incorporated late November 2024
- Two commercial co-founders (no technical co-founder)
- £40K contracted ARR with prototype only
- £500K+ pipeline
- Key conversations:
  - Biggest UK SMB payments platform
  - Biggest UK SMB bank
- Strong advisor network:
  - Dan Osborne (Chief Payments Officer, Payhawk)
  - Richard Dayton (SVP Big Data, FIS, AI Masters)
  - Jeff (Head Partner Fintech, Bain)
- Built prototype using Cursor and Vercel

### Fundraising Strategy & Approach

- Target: £1.5M pre-seed GBP
- Alternative considered: £750K angel round on SAFE/ASA
- Started fundraising last week, £100K angel commits in first 2 days
- Conversations with: Seed Camp, Octopus, Lightspeed Ventures

### Technical & Team Strategy

  - “Not giving 10% for skill set gap”
  - Will hire founding engineer as first hire
  - Citing co-founder relationship risks observed over career
- Platform approach leveraging existing network of 2,500+ platforms

### Business Philosophy & Funding Approach

- Focus on real profitable business vs VC-dependent model
- Skeptical of billion-dollar valuations without founder exits
- Prefers maintaining control and avoiding excessive dilution
- International expansion: UK → EU → US (demand-driven)
- Path to profitability prioritized over growth-at-all-costs

### Next Steps

- James: Send investment memo to interested VC (within 30 minutes)
- Elliot: Share draft memo examples for reference
- Schedule follow-up call tomorrow for continued discussion
